description:
Provides a resource to configure Load Balancer HTTP Monitor on NSX-T manager

~> **NOTE:** This resource requires NSX version 2.3 or higher.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

DisplayName.description: The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set.

FallCount.description: Number of consecutive checks that must fail before marking it down.

Interval.description: The frequency at which the system issues the monitor check (in seconds).

MonitorPort.description: If the monitor port is specified, it would override pool member port setting for healthcheck. A port range is not supported.

RequestBody.description: String to send as HTTP health check request body. Valid only for certain HTTP methods like POST.

RequestMethod.description: Health check method for HTTP monitor type. Valid values are GET, HEAD, PUT, POST and OPTIONS.

RequestVersion.description: HTTP request version. Valid values are HTTP_VERSION_1_0 and HTTP_VERSION_1_1.

ResponseBody.description: If response body is specified, healthcheck HTTP response body is matched against the specified string and server is considered healthy only if there is a match (regular expressions not supported). If response body string is not specified, HTTP healthcheck is considered successful if the HTTP response status code is among configured values.

ResponseStatusCodes.description: HTTP response status code should be a valid HTTP status code.

RiseCount.description: Number of consecutive checks that must pass before marking it up.

Timeout.description: Number of seconds the target has to respond to the monitor request.
